alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Currituck County through 400 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Currituck, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall could cause ponding of water on roadways. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Currituck around 330 PM EDT. Corolla around 355 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Barco, Coinjock, Snowden, Aydlett, Waterlily, Sligo and Maple. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
